title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
mflorea left at 00:01 (Quit: Leaving. rrodriguez left at 00:29 (Quit: rrodriguez asrfel left at 00:31 (Quit: Leaving. rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 00:38 rrodriguez left at 00:42 (Client Quit vmassol left at 00:53 (Quit: Leaving. npm left at 01:03 (Remote host closed the connection abusenius\_ joined #xwiki at 01:10 abusenius left at 01:11 (Remote host closed the connection npm joined #xwiki at 01:12 lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 01:24 lucaa left at 01:25 (Read error: No route to host lucaa1 left at 01:32 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds abusenius\_ left at 04:00 (Ping timeout: 250 seconds vmassol joined #xwiki at 07:13 vmassol left at 07:21 (Quit: Leaving. evalica joined #xwiki at 07:27 rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 07:33 mflorea joined #xwiki at 08:11 Enygma` joined #xwiki at 08:19 asrfel joined #xwiki at 08:43 Stulle joined #xwiki at 09:07 kibahop joined #xwiki at 09:15 kibahop left #xwiki at 09:16 kibahop joined #xwiki at 09:16 kibahop left #xwiki at 09:17 sburjan joined #xwiki at 09:24 rrodriguez left at 09:25 (Quit: rrodriguez arkub joined #xwiki at 09:36 rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 09:38 Stulle - (09:42): morning Stulle - (09:43): http://img585.imageshack.us/img585/8795/tablei.png <<< Stulle - (09:43): i got a bit of a problem with the tables again Stulle - (09:44): as you can see despite having set vertical-align:top for tables in the colibri.css and applying the latest fixes for this particular file it seems to me like the multiline cells on the right of the table are not at the top of the cell Stulle - (09:46): in fact, i noticed that when ever i use the group syntax ((( and ))) there is a bit of space before and after the group. suggestions on how to fix that? because it looks rather ugly... cjdelisle - (09:48): I don't know but I do know that html tables are strange and you might find the correct css foo on a blog if you google hard enough. silviar joined #xwiki at 09:49 Stulle - (09:49): hmmm, not a bad idea, indeed. Stulle - (09:50): do you know id sdumitru is coming in today? Stulle - (09:50): he seemed to be on good terms with the whole css stuff cjdelisle - (09:51): I think he'll be here. Stulle - (09:51): okay, thanks sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 09:54 Stulle - (09:56): speaking of him :-D sdumitriu - (09:56): Me? Stulle - (09:56): yep sburjan - (09:56): :) Stulle - (09:56): i am in a bit of a pinch sdumitriu - (09:56): I didn't do it! Stulle - (09:56): haha Stulle - (09:56): http://img585.imageshack.us/img585/8795/tablei.png sburjan - (09:56): sure you did :d sdumitriu - (09:56): I have a strong alibi Denis joined #xwiki at 09:57 Stulle - (09:57): you see the cells on the right? sdumitriu - (09:57): Denis: Ping Stulle - (09:57): they got some additional spacing on top and bottom Stulle - (09:57): which looks rather shitty Denis - (09:57): sdumitriu:  Hello Stulle - (09:57): i am trying to figure out how to remove that spacing. Stulle - (09:57): note the spacing is only applied if i use the ((( ))) group syntax to make cells with manual breaks sdumitriu - (09:57): Hi Denis, I wanted to ask you if you're planning on releasing 2.2.7 Stulle - (09:58): any ideas or hints? sdumitriu - (09:58): Stulle: Those are the margins for a paragraph Denis - (09:58): sdumitriu: No, never, doesn't Thomas already remove it from JIRA ? sdumitriu - (09:58): Denis: No sdumitriu - (09:58): I'll do it now, OK? jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:58 Denis - (09:58): sdumitriu: he ask me however, yes you can Stulle - (09:59): ah, i see. so any way of removing that for tables? or add it for all cells all together? sdumitriu - (10:00): Can you give the syntax you used? Stulle - (10:00): |cell1|cell2|((( Stulle - (10:00): cell3-1 Stulle - (10:00): cell3-2 Stulle - (10:00): ))) Stulle - (10:00): and so forth for the other lines, if they have multiple lines sdumitriu - (10:01): K, thanks Stulle - (10:01): and you are of course right, there is in fact a

statement in the html... didn't think this would be the cause. incidentally it's only there for multi line cells sdumitriu - (10:03): Stulle: You can add this to CSS: sdumitriu - (10:03): table p { margin: 0; } Stulle - (10:03): will try, thanks a bunch! Stulle - (10:04): whoa, you're awesome! :-D sdumitriu - (10:07): I'm not sure if this should make it into the default skin sdumitriu - (10:07): evalica: WDYT? Stulle - (10:08): imo yes... it gives consistency in the layout evalica - (10:08): ... that p is autogenerated with? Stulle - (10:08): no matter how many lines a cell has evalica - (10:09): Stulle are you sure you couldn't just remove the p, by taking extra spaces in the table? evalica - (10:09): taking off = remove Stulle - (10:10): what do you mean by extra spaces? Stulle - (10:10): like the line breaks after ((( and before )))? evalica - (10:11): I think maybe .. there is a ....|(space)S@ndy...| Stulle - (10:11): no there is not Stulle - (10:11): no leading spaces for any of the lines sdumitriu - (10:11): We could do something like: table p:first-child { margin-top: 0;} table p:last-child { margin-bottom: 0; } sdumitriu - (10:12): evalica: I tried without any whitespaces, it's the same sdumitriu - (10:12): It could be a bug in the rendering engine sdumitriu - (10:12): Perhaps it considers that a table cell is a block level container vmassol joined #xwiki at 10:12 Stulle - (10:13): sdumitriu: your suggestion would only remove the margins at the bottom or the top, am i understanding you right there? sdumitriu - (10:13): Yes vmassol - (10:13): sdumitriu: I agree about a new release versioning scheme :) sdumitriu - (10:13): But doesn't work in IE6 sdumitriu - (10:13): vmassol: Which one? vmassol - (10:14): sdumitriu: I'll send an internal mail first about it to you to see what you think Stulle - (10:14): well, it'd still work for me, we use IE7 and above here :) evalica - (10:15): sdumitriu: I can't replicate that p - I only get
... and I think we should allow p in tables evalica - (10:16): sdumitriu: I think that space is because of 2.6-SNAPSHOT, am I ok to change them to 2.7-SNAPSHOT? silviar - (10:18): Hi! I am adding bugs I find in XE2.6RC1 before release on this page http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/26Snapshots silviar - (10:18): sburjan: you can add yours as well sburjan - (10:19): i know sburjan - (10:19): silviar: we have a LOT of alignment issues silviar - (10:21): sbujan: If they first appeared in 2.6RC1 please add them to the same page; If they're older issues you can report them on Jira lucaa joined #xwiki at 10:22 vmassol - (10:27): sdumitriu: mail sent Stulle - (10:28): okay, something is off with the latest css from the SVN trunc... i just copied it to my instance and i get this shitty look in IE 7: http://img833.imageshack.us/img833/6576/colibricss.png Stulle - (10:28): it looks even worse around the comments area and various other places Stulle - (10:29): interestingly enough it's fine on IE8 and Opera 10.63 sburjan - (10:29): Stulle: what version are you on ? Stulle - (10:29): 2.5 final Stulle - (10:30): but with latest colibri.css evalica - (10:30): 2.5 or 2.6? evalica - (10:30): k Stulle - (10:30): in fact, it looks like that even if i only apply the changes that sdumitriu commit to colibri Stulle - (10:30): so i figure it's around the vertical align somewhere jbrBridge left at 10:30 (Quit: jbrBridge jbrBridge joined #xwiki at 10:31 cjdelisle - (10:34): Just ran the tests locally and java vacuumed up all my ram. sdumitriu - (10:35): vmassol: You should escape the syntax on http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/RenderingModule#HAddinganewLinkType cjdelisle - (10:36): hmm maybe a jvm5 bug sdumitriu - (10:36): cjdelisle: Yes, happens for me from time to time cjdelisle - (10:37): I'm a bit worried that something (maybe file io) is exposing a jvm malloc bug. (Attachments now use files) cjdelisle - (10:38): I'm going to setup the hudson jobs to build the 2.6 branch. vmassol - (10:39): sdumitriu: thanks Stulle - (10:39): just a brief update to the IE7 error, removing vertical-align: inherit; in the very first css style of colibri.css fixes the error for IE7 but breaks the vertical align fix for tables from sdumitriu sdumitriu - (10:40): Stulle: The IE test machine is down at the moment sdumitriu - (10:40): I'll try to reboot it Stulle - (10:40): cool, thanks a bunch sburjan - (10:40): mine is up :) sburjan - (10:40): testing now sburjan - (10:40): an a 2.5 Stulle - (10:41): make sure to apply the last colibri.css from the svn Stulle - (10:41): otherwise you won't see a thing arkub left at 10:42 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds vmassol - (10:43): sburjan: good morning. Would be great if you could test XE2.6RC1 today sburjan - (10:44): I was doing that vmassol - (10:44): cool sburjan - (10:45): Stulle: yes, I can confirm your thing ralucaM joined #xwiki at 10:45 silviar - (10:45): vmassol: Good morning! Testing as well. We'll document any issues we find on this page: http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/26Snapshots vmassol - (10:45): silviar: ok thanks vmassol - (10:46): I'm looking for blocker issues Stulle - (10:46): also, it seems like the fix is not working on IE7 either... vmassol - (10:46): 1) either real blocking and the release needs to be redone ASAP vmassol - (10:46): or sburjan - (10:46): Stulle: how is your WYSIWYG windows rendered ? vmassol - (10:46): 2) blocking issue for 2.6 final that need to be done in 2.6RC2 vmassol - (10:46): (silviar) Stulle - (10:46): will check sburjan - (10:47): my wysiwyg editor has only one line for input.. not an text area Stulle - (10:47): can barely see a thing sburjan - (10:47): 2.5.1 UI is broken on IE7 sburjan - (10:47): this must be a blocker sburjan - (10:47): testing on IE6 also silviar - (10:48): vmassol: We'll add all issues on the page and mark blockers as such. Sorin will later report on Jira the ones that are not blockers. vmassol - (10:48): ok sburjan - (10:48): vmassol: don't release 2.5.1 yet vmassol - (10:48): well all need to be reported in jira of course vmassol - (10:48): sburjan: I'm not releasing 2.5.x at all fm joined #xwiki at 10:48 vmassol - (10:48): only 2.6RC1 sburjan - (10:48): oh yes .. sdumitriu then Stulle - (10:49): i reckon it will also be on that release if it makes use of latest colibri.css cjdelisle - (10:51): WDYT of adding a hudson job to run the tests on the 2.6-rc1 tag? Stulle - (10:52): ahhhm i think i got it Stulle - (10:52): hold on a sec Stulle - (10:52): http://reference.sitepoint.com/css/inheritvalue silviar - (10:55): vmassol: login does not work on IE6 Stulle - (10:55): although i am not sure how to fix it with the information that inherit won't do on IE7 and below... i really lack any sufficient css skill, sorry silviar - (10:55): reporting it right now vmassol - (10:57): let's announce in the Release notes htat we've dropped IE6 support starting with XE 2.6! vmassol - (10:57): :) vmassol - (10:57): and that'll solve it cjdelisle - (10:57): +1 Stulle - (10:57): :-D sburjan - (10:58): IE7 too :) vmassol - (10:58): all browsers! Stulle - (10:58): X-D cjdelisle - (10:59): Support ie6 --> work around all the virals that are on the average ie6 box due to many many browser exploits. sburjan - (10:59): so all IE support for 6 & 7 is a blocker Stulle - (10:59): well, dropping IE7 would put me in a dire pinch... i'd have to explain that to my boss and i just convinced him of using XWiki... what a shame Stulle - (10:59): ;) cjdelisle - (11:00): ie7 is not very nice either but it's not >10 years old yet and google still supports it. Stulle - (11:00): true cjdelisle - (11:00): ie6 is the win3.1 of browsers. sburjan - (11:01): :D Stulle - (11:01): i don't even think the problem is that my company wouldn't want to use IE8 and Win7... the problem is IBM being incapable of pushing out systems on Win7 after a year of stable Win 7 experiences around the world -.- Stulle - (11:01): that's what you get for outsorcing... cjdelisle - (11:02): IBM likes linux so no surprise their win support is flaky. Stulle - (11:03): if that is the case they should prolly not offer to make huge contracts with companies which have to rely heavily on windows for use of CAD software and thelike... Stulle - (11:04): all i can say is that the IBM support is pretty bad here and this is pretty annoying sburjan - (11:04): sdumitriu: , vmassol  : I am gonna put on top of the page things I find on 2.5 here : http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/25Snapshots cjdelisle - (11:04): well IBM/linux that is more about servers. Stulle - (11:05): trying to get the machine on which XWiki runs to make contact to the smtp server for about a month now and when i finally get the helpdesk to send me a local person that particular person tries to call me when i'm on lunch break and stalls the freaking ticket... AFTER A MONTH! cjdelisle - (11:06): connecting to smtp isn't that hard, if the server won't talk to you, you can use an external server where you have an account. cjdelisle - (11:06): wireshark > \* Stulle - (11:06): yeah but there is a smtp server in the network and the smtp group told me the problem is somewhere on the way Stulle - (11:07): but it's not my firewall, i confirmed it Stulle - (11:07): anyway, regarding the IE7 problem i was talking about earlier Stulle - (11:07): stackoverflow suggests using a java script to fix the inherit trouble on IE7 fm - (11:08): does anyone know where named queries are defined? (e.g. "getSpaces" in getStore().getQueryManager().getNamedQuery("getSpaces")) silviar - (11:08): New issues for 2.6RC1 http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/26Snapshots#HBLOCKERBaddisplayofWikiPreferencesonIE7 cjdelisle - (11:08): ^^ typical. go to the average website and see some javascript which detects IE with some searing about M$ cjdelisle - (11:08): \*swearing Stulle - (11:09): yeah, that's about it, actually... the suggestion is to use http://ie7-js.googlecode.com Stulle - (11:09): didn't look into it much, yet cjdelisle - (11:09): fm, http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/resources/queries.hbm.xml fm - (11:10): cjdelisle: thanks cjdelisle - (11:11): http://isc.sans.edu/diary.html?storyid=9874 sburjan - (11:13): new issues on http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/25Snapshots silviar - (11:14): vmassol: please take a look at these issues http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Test/26Snapshots#HBLOCKERBaddisplayofWikiPreferencesonIE7 cjdelisle - (11:15): ``Seems that chackboxes don't vertically allign middle correctly.'' <-- there's an issue for that. Stulle - (11:16): the attachment thingy has been around since at least 2.4 iirc cjdelisle - (11:17): `attachment thingy' ? Stulle - (11:18): Summary in History for adding Attachments displays code, in addition to the attachment name cjdelisle - (11:18): XAADMINISTRATION-151 sdumitriu - (11:20): I'll re-release 2.5.1 vmassol - (11:20): sdumitriu: does it mean I have to re-release something too? sdumitriu - (11:20): No sburjan - (11:20): yes ... 2.6 has most of these problems too sdumitriu - (11:21): You still have the rc2 vmassol - (11:21): pfew… ;) vmassol - (11:21): ok sorin please help me put whatever is not working in the release notes sdumitriu - (11:21): Which was planned for next Monday, do you intend to keep the date? vmassol - (11:21): (I'm editing it now) cjdelisle - (11:21): re-release 2.5.1? seems like the version numbering has gotten a lot more strange lately. vmassol - (11:21): sdumitriu: we need that mail to page stuff asap sburjan - (11:23): vmassol: you should talk to silviar , she is testing on 2.6RC1 sburjan - (11:23): but I can help too, because most of the issues are the same silviar - (11:25): sburjan: You can check out the page I provided a link to above and make a summary of the issues I find (in progress) sburjan - (11:26): ok vmassol - (11:35): mflorea: I need your help on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise26RC1 vmassol - (11:35): (regarding the portlet changes you did - if they're substantial enough to be in the RN) sdumitriu - (11:36): Stulle: Sorry, I really can't fix the vertical-align issue for IE6/7 mflorea - (11:36): vmassol: changes I did on the platform are not significant. I have significant changes to commit to contrib but that's different vmassol - (11:37): ok I'll remove that patt vmassol - (11:37): part Stulle - (11:37): yep, figured so. i think java script hacking would really be the only way to go... Stulle - (11:37): so what are you gonna do now? revert the fix you uploaded the other day? sdumitriu - (11:38): Partially sdumitriu - (11:38): I'll fix it only for the other browsers Stulle - (11:38): well, that would also be great, imo Stulle - (11:39): so at least only IE7 is affected sdumitriu - (11:39): Sorry, but older IEs make it really really hard to fix stuff like this Stulle - (11:39): and i can just blame IBM for not updating to IE 8 :-D sdumitriu - (11:39): Yep Stulle - (11:39): yeah, i hear you! sdumitriu - (11:40): Stulle: You're at IBM? Stulle - (11:40): compatibility is a pain in the ass Stulle - (11:40): nope, but my company outsourced their it to IBM Stulle - (11:40): which is probably even worse! vmassol - (11:41): evalica, sburjan, silviar, lucaa: can someone help me by creating the documentation for the recentactivity macro (named the page Macros.Activity please)? vmassol - (11:42): also if you have some nice screenshot of the recent activity dashboard to put in the release notes that would be great sburjan - (11:43): vmassol: I will help vmassol - (11:43): thanks Stulle - (11:43): lunch time... :) cu later! evalica - (11:44): vmassol: I will make the recentactivity macro page - I will put it in code macros, k? sburjan - (11:44): vmassol: I don't see the page created (Macros.Activity) sburjan - (11:45): okay evalica :) evalica - (11:45): vmassol: the page should be recentactivity or activity? - when we rename the macro we make another page? evalica - (11:46): lol :) k I read above Macros.Activity l vmassol - (11:49): evalica: Macros.ActivityMacro IMO vmassol - (11:49): (I missed the trailing "Macro" suffix) evalica - (11:50): k sburjan - (11:51): vmassol: I'm creating the section on what's not working on the 2.6RC1. I will only mention things, without screenshots cjdelisle - (11:51): updating the pom.xml files in enterprise/trunk to 2.7-SNAPSHOT vmassol - (11:55): cjdelisle: thanks cjdelisle - (11:55): Is it me or has the notification list stopped? silviar - (11:58): sburjan: you can use an error macro for the release notes (see this example http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise242). Talk about how you cannot login with IE6 and that XE is not fully usable with IE7 (add a list of the issues we've identified; keep an eye on the incubator page for more issues I am currently reporting) sburjan - (11:58): i know Stulle - (12:05): re cjdelisle - (12:05): I'm going to add a hudson job for testing 2.6-rc-1, if we don't like the idea we can always remove it. vmassol - (12:06): +1 for 2.6 branch vmassol - (12:06): (not 2.6-rc-1) vmassol - (12:06): (cjdelisle) cjdelisle - (12:06):  2.6 branch is already done. Why not test rc1? vmassol - (12:06): well it's a one time test execution vmassol - (12:07): which we can do on our machines no? vmassol - (12:07): you want to add it and then remove it? vmassol - (12:07): it's ok with me cjdelisle - (12:07): I tried to run the tests on the tag and some ran and it stopped. vmassol - (12:07): ok go ahead vmassol - (12:07): thanks cjdelisle - (12:07): IMO a hudson test makes the results "official". vmassol - (12:07): we'll need to remove it later on vmassol - (12:07): to prevent flickering test mails vmassol - (12:08): indeed vmassol - (12:08): I agree arkub joined #xwiki at 12:08 cjdelisle - (12:08): Or just only trigger it manually and update it during each release. vmassol - (12:08): yes better vmassol - (12:08): +1 for manual cjdelisle - (12:08): I'll test pilot it for now, maybe this can be proposed as a standard practice. vmassol - (12:08): yes cjdelisle - (12:09): ``xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-RELEASE-CANDIDATE'' that work for a name? cjdelisle - (12:09): or xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-RC vmassol - (12:11): 2.6-rc-1 vmassol - (12:11): xwiki-product-enterprise-tests-2.6-rc-1 cjdelisle - (12:11): Ok then it won't be able to be generic (updated and used per release.) vmassol - (12:11): you can rename the job no? vmassol - (12:11): or copy it and dleete the old one cjdelisle - (12:12): Ok. cjdelisle - (12:13): added and scheduled. Coffee time. lucaa - (12:15): guys, I need a property in an xwiki class that would contain a list of user inserted strings lucaa - (12:15): like a regular string field, but a list of such lucaa - (12:15): what type should I use? I think I can use a static list with multiple select and relational storage and input editor lucaa - (12:15): or a db list with these props lucaa - (12:16): what would you advise? lucaa - (12:16): ( sdumitriu ?  ) rrodriguez left at 12:16 (Quit: rrodriguez vmassol - (12:19): sburjan: next time we need to plan ahead better the testing phase before the release sburjan - (12:19): yes sdumitriu - (12:20): lucaa: Let me get this right sdumitriu - (12:21): The list has no initial values, when the database is clean sdumitriu - (12:21): Users can add any values there sdumitriu - (12:21): After some values are in there, when a user starts typing, a suggestion appears sdumitriu - (12:21): Is that correct? lucaa - (12:22): I don't care that much about suggestion lucaa - (12:22): what I want is to be able to query the objects table for values in this list sdumitriu - (12:22): But won't a simple StringProperty do that? lucaa - (12:22): which is why I don't want a plain string field separated by comma sdumitriu - (12:23): Oh, you mean you want multiselect lucaa - (12:23): yes lucaa - (12:23): I want multiselect lucaa - (12:23): forgot to emphasise it sdumitriu - (12:23): StaticList, multiselect+relstorage true lucaa - (12:23): (as I said above) sdumitriu - (12:23): display: input lucaa - (12:23): ok lucaa - (12:23): ok lucaa - (12:23): thanks for the confirmation sdumitriu - (12:23): No specified value vmassol - (12:26): silviar, sburjan, evalica: do you have a nice recent activity screenshot for the RN? vmassol - (12:27): I can use the default one but it's not particularly nice evalica - (12:27): not yet - I will make one mflorea left at 12:27 (Quit: Leaving. vmassol - (12:27): evalica: btw any progress on the xwiki syntax page. I'd like to improve our current content + start adding stuff for xwiki syntax 2.1 vmassol - (12:27): ? Stulle\_ joined #xwiki at 12:28 evalica - (12:28): vmassol: haven't done anything - and anyway what I have in mind will involve JS so I don't think it will be so simple to integrate Stulle\_ - (12:29): sdumitriu: great job, fixes the allign issue for Opera 10.63 and IE8 and keeps IE7 from looking all crappy! Stulle left at 12:31 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds vmassol - (12:31): evalica: my view is something like a left menu with topics + a top level select box for choosing the syntax vmassol - (12:31): topics = text formatting, links, images, etc vmassol - (12:31): what's your idea? Stulle\_ is now known as Stulle (8123cca2@gateway/web/freenode/ip.129.35.204.162 evalica - (12:36): didn't thought about topics, but I wanted some checkboxex in the top: as filters (than contain syntaxes) [ (v\_red) 1.0, (v\_blue) 2.0, (\_) 2.1]  that also have a color association and after them, a textarea that shows first line in red the 1.0 syntax; next line with blue indented the 2.0 syntax .... this way you can enable/disable syntaxes to visualize differences vmassol - (12:37): I'm not sure we need diff vmassol - (12:37): when someone picks a syntax he doesn't want to see other syntaxes vmassol - (12:37): just his syntax vmassol - (12:37): I see what you mean though evalica - (12:40): I usually want differences when I have something in 1.0 and want to write in 2.0 lucaa - (12:41): sdumitriu: and how do I query?
